#Text=Annie Ivanova

#Text=Antoanetta " Annie " Ivanova ( Bulgarian : Антоанета Иванова ; Chinese Traditional : 易安妮 Yì Ānnī ) is an international curator and author , cultural entrepreneur [ 1 ] and one of Australia 's leading authorities on cultural diplomacy . [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]

#Text=Ivanova has collaborated with the Centre Pompidou , Ars Electronica , Barbican , Smithsonian Institution , National Palace Museum , Australian Centre for the Moving Image , and Queensland Gallery of Modern Art , among others . [ 5 ]
#Text=Education
#Text=Annie Ivanova holds MA qualifications in Foreign Affairs and International Trade from Monash University , Graduate School of Business and Economics in Melbourne .
#Text=She pursued interests in Global Leadership , Cultural Diplomacy , Entrepreneurship and Strategic Management . { cn }

#Text=Ivanova was a team leader for an International Law Moot Court Competition , debating the issue of terrorism and human rights through a fictional dispute between two states presented to the International Court of Justice .
#Text=Ivanova 's first academic degree is from the University of Tasmania , graduating with Bachelor of Fine Arts ( BFA Hons . ) in 1998 .
#Text=Her Honours theses discussed the effect of mass media when reporting stories about war atrocities .
#Text=In the late 1980s Ivanova studied at the Bulgarian National College of Polygraphs and Photography .
#Text=The college was one of the then most progressive professional schools in the country , preparing students for careers in film and TV .
#Text=She majored in photography , specialising in photojournalism .
#Text=Career
#Text=Professionally active since 1996 , Annie Ivanova has initiated and realised over 80 international exhibitions , conferences and public diplomacy projects .
#Text=She is a Fellow of the Australian Institute of Company Directors and Australian Institute of International Affairs .
#Text=Ivanova has chaired and produced three major international conferences , [ 6 ] [ 7 ] [ 8 ] and has been a keynote speaker on wide-ranging Culture & Creative Industries topics . [ 9 ]

#Text=Global work scope spans : USA , Canada , UK , France , Germany , Spain , Italy , Austria , Denmark , Finland , Iceland , Eastern Europe , Greece , Turkey , Malaysia , Thailand , Vietnam , China , Korea , Japan , Singapore , Taiwan , and Australia .
#Text=Ivanova co-founded and was the executive director of Australia 's first media arts agency Novamedia Ltd. [ 10 ]
#Text=Between 2001 – 2011 , Novamedia represented some of Australia 's most renowned media artists : Jon MacCormack , Stelarc , Drew Berry , Troy Innocent , Justine Cooper , George Khut .
#Text=It also initiated and produced projects for Australia 's overseas diplomatic missions . [ 11 ] [ 12 ]

#Text=In 2012 Australia Unlimited , the national branding campaign promoting Australia 's most inspiring achievers , featured Ivanova 's blockbuster exhibition ' Wonderland : New Contemporary Art from Australia ' at MOCATaipei . [ 13 ]
#Text=The piece was narrated by art historian Edmund Capon .
#Text=Ivanova is the first and only foreign curator to travel across Taiwan to work with the Taiwanese aborigines , researching artists from every tribe . [ 14 ]
#Text=She has become a passionate advocate for the preservation of local indigenous heritage .
#Text=In a public statement she says : " Elders are dying out without their knowledge being recorded .

column1: #Text=She is also the only businesswoman awarded that year .
#Text=Annie Ivanova is also the Regional President of Asia Designer Communication Platform .
#Text=Personal life
#Text=Annie Ivanova was born in Tryavna , Bulgaria to an artistic family .
#Text=Her father was an industrial designer and her mother drama teacher .
#Text=Her grandfather had a professional photographic studio in the 1930s .
#Text=During the 1989 revolution Ivanova was working as a junior reporter , assisting Reuters photographer Oleg Popov .
#Text=She was a front-line witness of the dramatic events leading to the collapse of communism in Sofia .
#Text=Soon after , with the help of a colleague , she moved to London where she studied design at the London College of Fashion .
#Text=In 1994 Ivanova immigrated to Australia .
#Text=Ivanova identifies herself as an Australian of Bulgarian heritage .
#Text=She has commented that her international work has always been about ' persuading through culture and ideas that reach across borders ' . [ 18 ]
#Text=She has said the Balkan atrocities of the 1990s have left a very deep mark in her mind , becoming a motivational force to pursue a career in international relations .
#Text=Following long term interests in Asian culture , since 2010 she has been living between Melbourne and Taipei .
#Text=The Chinese name given to her by a friend is 易安妮 ( Yì Ānnī ) .
#Text=Yì was taken from the character in I-Ching " Book of Changes " as an auspicious match .
#Text=In Taiwan she is known by her Chinese name . [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 21 ]
#Text=Taiwan by Design
#Text=Annie Ivanova is the acclaimed author of " Taiwan by Design : 88 products for better living " [ 22 ]
#Text=the first comprehensive design book from the Beautiful Island .
#Text=The project took 2.5 years to complete and run a hugely successful crowdfunding campaign raising NT 1,500,000 . [ 23 ]
#Text=The North American release of the book featured on CNN , [ 24 ] and it was reported as breaking news by all major newspapers [ 25 ] in Taiwan .
#Text=Significant Exhibitions
#Text=International Curator-in-Residence
